definition: neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct
to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: The views of the Three Generation Leading Group share the same root and keep pace with times.
sentences.chinese: 三代中央領導集體的發展觀既一脈相承，又與時俱進。

sentences.english: The second part, the second leading collective of China Communist Party's diplomatic thought to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分，中共第二代領導集體的對日外交思想。

sentences.english: At present, the new leadership group is conducting the work in a sorted-out manner.
sentences.chinese: 現在，新一屆中央領導集體正有條不紊地開展工作。

sentences.english: We should correctly and consciously handle the relationships between the core and leadership collective.
sentences.chinese: 核心也要自覺正確處理好與領導集體的關係。

sentences.english: All the three leading groups of CPC pay great attention to the position and role of the Corps.
sentences.chinese: 黨中央三代領導集體都十分重視兵團的地位和作用。
